channel.title: Smart Sound Monitoring
channel.description: Recent content on Smart Sound Monitoring

item.title: Week 7
item.description: On April 3rd, we had a meeting with our coordinator Luís Caldas de Oliveira and our assistant Rafael Cordeiro to discuss our first pitch deck.

item.title: Week 6
item.description: In the 3rd meeting with our project assistant, we confirmed the necessary features for the intermediate delivery - namely the acquisition of pure sinusoids and its representation in both time and frequency domains.

item.title: Week 5
item.description: In the 5th week of the project, Gonçalo Lázaro began working on the Arduino Nano RP2040.

item.title: Week 4
item.description: In the 4th week of the project, we met with our project assistant, Professor Rafael Cordeiro, to discuss the goals for the intermediate delivery of April 1st.

item.title: Week 3
item.description: This week, Pedro Martins interviewd sound technicias who work for Watt-Light, the company that was hired by the Electrical and Computer Engineering student team for their anual event.

item.title: Weeks 1 and 2
item.description: In the first two weeks, Frederico Paula and Nuno Jorge interviewd sound professionals and possible Smart Sound Monitoring clients.

item.title: Hello, World!
item.description: Nuno Jorge launched the Smart Sound Monitoring website on the IST server; it is officially up and running.

item.title: Website Development
item.description: Nuno Jorge began the development of the Smart Sound Monitoring website, using the Meghna theme, distributed by HUGO.
